examples.korean: They should win, given a modicum of luck. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 운이 조금만 따라 준다면 그들이 이길 것이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: They should win, given a modicum of luck. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: A little luck wouldn’t go amiss right now! 듣기 Add to Wordbook 바로 이럴 때 약간의 운이 따라 준다면 반가울 텐데! Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: A little luck wouldn’t go amiss right now! Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: ‘With a bit of luck, we’ll be finished by the end of the year.’ ‘Yes, and pigs might fly!’ 듣기 Add to Wordbook “운이 조금만 따라 준다면 우리가 연말까지는 끝마칠 텐데.” “그렇게 된다면 내 손에 장을 지지겠어!” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘With a bit of luck, we’ll be finished by the end of the year.’ ‘Yes, and pigs might fly!’ Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Well I’m buggered if I’m going to help her after what she said to me. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 글쎄 그녀가 나한테 한 말을 듣고도 내가 그녀를 도와준다면 사람이 아니지. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Well I’m buggered if I’m going to help her after what she said to me. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: If he helps us, maybe we can tug the car out of here. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그가 도와준다면 아마도 우리는 여기서 차를 끌어낼 수 있을 거야. 절대어휘 5100
examples.english: If he helps us, maybe we can tug the car out of here. Add to Wordbook
